author: Amarnath Tewary
text:
While Bihar Finance Minister Abdul Bari Siddiqui on Friday presented the State budget of Rs. 1,44,696 crore for 2016-17 with no fresh tax proposals, the Opposition BJP slammed the government over the ‘deteriorating’ law and order situation. The BJP also termed the budget “eyewash.”

Presenting the budget, Mr. Siddiqui said the focus has been put on the implementation of the “seven resolves” of Chief Minister Nitish Kumar for the holistic development of the State. Besides, emphasis has been given to education, energy and health sectors with maximum allocation.

The BJP slammed the budget saying there was nothing new it. “This budget has nothing to cheer about… it’s just an eyewash to fool the people,” said BJP leader Nand Kishore Yadav.

Another BJP leader Sushil Kumar Modi alleged that the budgetary allocation to the education sector had, in fact, been slashed from the previous budget and still the government claimed it as a progressive one.

The BJP and its allies created a ruckus over the law and order situation in the State and the recent killings of some Opposition leaders, which led to the adjournment of the House in the first session. The ruling party leaders said “jungle raj was prevailing under Central government in Delhi and not in Bihar.”
title: Focus on ‘seven resolves’ of Nitish in Bihar budget
